entries.meaning: A pose taken in opposition to another.
examples: Utkatasana (Figure 4-e) acts as a counterpose to the previous postures because it eases the stretch in the legs.

verbs.description: counterpose (third-person singular simple present counterposes, present participle counterposing, simple past and past participle counterposed)

entries.meaning: To act as a counterweight; to counterbalance.
